need-docs.title: To sell your airplane, you will need:

docs.title: Valid pilot's license or state-issued ID

need-docs.need-docs-asq: Additional paperwork will be required if the airplane is:

listAsq.title: Credited:
listAsq.content:
• Loan payoff information
  • Account number and lender's contact information

listAsq.title: Corporate:
listAsq.content:
• Articles of incorporation or business license
  • Letter authorizing the sale on company letterhead
  • Employer Identification Number (EIN)

feedback.content: Parting with my private jet was a big decision, but these professionals made it easier. They were knowledgeable about the market and offered a competitive price. The process was discreet and efficient. Highly recommend for high-end aircraft sales.
feedback.name: William T.

feedback.content: Sold my small plane to these folks in Florida. They knew their stuff about general aviation and gave a fair offer. The paperwork took a bit longer than expected, hence 4 stars, but overall a good experience.
feedback.name: Amanda G.

feedback.content: These guys bought my light aircraft, and I'm impressed with their service. They offered a good price and handled all the complex paperwork. The whole process was smooth from start to finish.
feedback.name: Daniel F.

listAsq.title: What types of aircraft do you purchase?
listAsq.content: Our company actively acquires a diverse range of aircraft, including ultralight aircraft, light single-engine aircraft, twin-engine piston aircraft, light turboprop aircraft, light jets, medium business jets, and large business jets. We work with all major manufacturers such as Cessna, Beechcraft, Cirrus, Embraer, Bombardier, Gulfstream, and others.

listAsq.title: How do you determine an aircraft's value?
listAsq.content: Our valuation process is comprehensive and data-driven. We consider factors such as the aircraft's make, model, year of manufacture, total time on airframe and engines, avionics package, maintenance status (including time remaining until major inspections), and current market trends. Our team utilizes industry-leading valuation tools and databases to ensure we provide a fair and competitive offer.

listAsq.title: Can I sell a financed aircraft?
listAsq.content: Yes, we have extensive experience in purchasing aircraft with existing financial commitments. We can work with financed aircraft at any stage of the loan repayment process, as well as leased aircraft both under active agreements and those that have completed their lease terms. Our team is adept at managing these complex transactions to ensure a smooth process for all parties involved.

listAsq.title: What documentation is required?
listAsq.content:
To facilitate a seamless transaction, we typically require the following documentation:
  • Aircraft registration certificate
  • Airworthiness certificate
  • Logbooks (airframe, engine, and propeller if applicable)
  • Maintenance records
  • Avionics log
  • Weight and balance information
  • Any Supplemental Type Certificates (STCs) or modifications
  • Bill of sale
  • Lease or finance agreements (if applicable) Our team will guide you through the documentation process to ensure all necessary paperwork is in order.

listAsq.title: Do you handle transportation after purchase?
listAsq.content: Yes, we offer comprehensive post-purchase transportation services. Depending on the aircraft type and location, we can arrange for professional ferry pilots to fly the aircraft to its new destination, or we can coordinate ground transportation for smaller aircraft. All transportation is handled by qualified professionals and fully insured.

listAsq.title: How does the inspection process work?
listAsq.content:
Our inspection process is thorough and conducted by certified aircraft inspectors. It typically includes:
  • A detailed review of all aircraft records and logbooks
  • A comprehensive physical inspection of the airframe, engines, and avionics
  • Operational checks of all systems
  • A test flight (when possible) We strive to complete the inspection efficiently while ensuring no detail is overlooked. Our team will coordinate with you to minimize any disruption to your operations during this process.

listAsq.title: Do you operate throughout the entire United States?
listAsq.content: While our primary network doesn't cover the entire United States, we have established partnerships that enable us to work with customers nationwide. We can arrange for the inspection and acquisition of aircraft from any location in the country. For more distant locations, please allow an additional 1-2 days for our team to make necessary arrangements. We are dedicated to providing exceptional service to every customer, regardless of their location.
